methods.name: public VirtualMouseScrollEvent build()
methods.comment: * Creates a {@link VirtualMouseScrollEvent} object with the current builder configuration.

methods.name: public Builder setXAxisMovement(@FloatRange(from = -1.0f, to = 1.0f) float xAxisMovement)
methods.comment:
* Sets the x-axis scroll movement, normalized from -1.0 to 1.0, inclusive. Positive values
         * indicate scrolling upward; negative values, downward.
         *
         * @return this builder, to allow for chaining of calls

methods.name: public Builder setYAxisMovement(@FloatRange(from = -1.0f, to = 1.0f) float yAxisMovement)
methods.comment:
* Sets the y-axis scroll movement, normalized from -1.0 to 1.0, inclusive. Positive values
         * indicate scrolling towards the right; negative values, to the left.
         *
         * @return this builder, to allow for chaining of calls

methods.name: public Builder setEventTimeNanos(long eventTimeNanos)
methods.comment:
* Sets the time (in nanoseconds) when this specific event was generated. This may be
         * obtained from {@link SystemClock#uptimeMillis()} (with nanosecond precision instead of
         * millisecond), but can be different depending on the use case.
         * This field is optional and can be omitted.
         *
         * @return this builder, to allow for chaining of calls
         * @see InputEvent#getEventTime()

methodNames: public Builder setXAxisMovement(@FloatRange(from = -1.0f, to = 1.0f) float xAxisMovement)
public Builder setYAxisMovement(@FloatRange(from = -1.0f, to = 1.0f) float yAxisMovement)
